definition: to write on behalf of sb/to ghostwrite
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: I Tertius, who wrote this epistle, salute you in the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 我這代筆寫信的德丟，在主裏面問你們安。

sentences.english: How many books have you ghostwritten so far?
sentences.chinese: 到現在爲止你給多少書代筆。

sentences.english: The speech of the director was ghosted.
sentences.chinese: 那名董事的演講辭是別人代筆的。

sentences.english: So all the quotation marks suggest human voice.
sentences.chinese: 所以引號代筆了人類的聲音。

sentences.english: They can also ghostwrite for you.
Eg: As a ghostwriter, he earned a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 他作爲代筆人掙了一大筆錢。

sentences.english: Landscape seems his teacher, and more than its ghostwrite.
sentences.chinese: 山水似其師，並多爲其代筆。

definition: to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
Su Manshu (1884-1918), Chinese writer, journalist, Buddhist monk, participant in the revolutionary movement
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
